body.p: You can use to generate detailed documentation for the components of a WSDL document in HTML format. You can select what WSDL components to include in your output and the level of details to present for each of them. Also, the components are hyperlinked.The WSDL documentation includes the XML Schema components that belong to the internal or imported XML schemas.To obtain the documentation in a custom format, use custom stylesheets.

To generate documentation for a WSDL document, go to Tools XML Tools Generate Documentation WSDL Documentation... . You can also open the WSDL Documentation dialog from the contextual menu in the Project view: Generate Documentation WSDL Documentation... . You can also open the WSDL Documentation dialog from the contextual menu in the Navigator: Generate WSDL Documentation .

fig.title: The Output Panel of the WSDL Documentation Dialog
The Output Panel of the WSDL Documentation Dialog

body.p: The Input URL field of the dialog panel must contain the full path to the WSDL document that you want to generate documentation for. The WSDL document can be located either local or remote. You can also specify the path to the WSDL document using editor variables.

You can split the output into multiple files using different criteria. For large WSDL documents, choosing a different split criterion may generate smaller output files providing a faster documentation browsing.

To export the settings of the WSDL Documentation dialog to an XML file, click the Export settings button. With the exported settings file, you can generate the same documentation from the command-line interface.
